review_service package

Submodules

review_service.models module

class review_service.models.Review(inventory_id, customer_id, rating, comment)[source]

Bases: Model

The Review object represents a customer review for an inventory item.

Parameters:

  • inventory_id (int) – The ID of the inventory item being reviewed

  • customer_id (int) – The ID of the customer who submitted the review

  • rating (int) – The rating given by the customer

  • comment (str, optional) – The comment provided by the customer (optional)

Variables:

  • review_id (int) – The unique identifier for the review

  • inventory_id (int) – The ID of the inventory item being reviewed

  • customer_id (int) – The ID of the customer who submitted the review

  • date (str) – The date when the review was submitted

  • rating (int) – The rating given by the customer

  • comment (str) – The comment provided by the customer (optional)

  • flag (bool, optional) – A moderation flag indicating the review’s status (e.g., inappropriate or spam)

class review_service.models.ReviewSchema(*, only: types.StrSequenceOrSet | None = None, exclude: types.StrSequenceOrSet = (), many: bool = False, context: dict | None = None, load_only: types.StrSequenceOrSet = (), dump_only: types.StrSequenceOrSet = (), partial: bool | types.StrSequenceOrSet | None = None, unknown: str | None = None)[source]

Bases: Schema

The ReviewSchema object is used for serializing and deserializing review data.

Variables:

  • Meta.fields (tuple) – The fields included in the schema (‘review_id’, ‘inventory_id’, ‘customer_id’, ‘date’, ‘rating’, ‘comment’, ‘flag’)

  • Meta.model (Review) – The associated model for the schema (Review)

review_service.review module

review_service.review.delete_review()[source]

Delete an existing review.

Parameters:

review_id (int) – The ID of the review to be deleted

Raises:

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 400 for bad requests, 403 for unauthorized access, 404 if review is not found, 500 for server errors

Returns:

Success message confirming the deletion

Return type:

flask.Response

review_service.review.get_customer_reviews()[source]

Get all reviews submitted by a specific customer.

Parameters:

customer_id (int) – The ID of the customer

Raises:

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 400 for bad requests, 403 for unauthorized access, 500 for server errors

Returns:

JSON representation of all reviews submitted by the customer

Return type:

flask.Response

review_service.review.get_product_reviews(inventory_id)[source]

Get all reviews for a specific product.

Parameters:

inventory_id (int) – The ID of the inventory item

Raises:

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 500 for server errors

Returns:

JSON representation of all reviews for the product

Return type:

flask.Response

review_service.review.get_review_details()[source]

Retrieve details of a specific review.

Parameters:

review_id (int) – The ID of the review

Raises:

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 400 for bad requests, 403 for unauthorized access, 404 if review is not found, 500 for server errors

Returns:

JSON representation of the review details

Return type:

flask.Response

review_service.review.moderate_reviews()[source]

Moderate a review (flag or delete).

Parameters:

  • review_id (int) – The ID of the review to be moderated

  • flag (str) – The moderation flag (e.g., inappropriate, spam)

Raises:

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 400 for bad requests, 403 for unauthorized access, 404 if review is not found, 500 for server errors

Returns:

JSON representation of the moderated review or success message for deletion

Return type:

flask.Response

review_service.review.submit_review()[source]

Submit a review for a product.

Parameters:

  • inventory_id (int) – The ID of the inventory item being reviewed

  • rating (int) – The rating given by the customer

  • comment (str) – The review comment

Raises:

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 400 for bad requests, 403 for unauthorized access, 500 for server errors

Returns:

JSON representation of the created review

Return type:

flask.Response

review_service.review.update_review()[source]

Update an existing review.

Parameters:

  • review_id (int) – The ID of the review to be updated

  • rating (int, optional) – (Optional) The updated rating

  • comment (str, optional) – (Optional) The updated comment

Raises:

werkzeug.exceptions.HTTPException – 400 for bad requests, 403 for unauthorized access, 404 if review is not found, 500 for server errors

Returns:

JSON representation of the updated review

Return type:

flask.Response
